documentation:
Collection of types related to naming, labelling and general
identification within Dogen.

elements.name: entities
elements.documentation:
Stores all of the entities related to identification
of Dogen elements.

elements.name: entities::name
elements.documentation: General name for modeling elements which do not need any specialisation.

attributes.name: qualified
attributes.documentation: Qualified name for an element.

elements.name: entities::codec_provenance
elements.documentation: Source of a model element in the codec dimension.

attributes.name: model_id
attributes.documentation: ID for a model.

attributes.name: model_type
attributes.documentation: Type of the model where this element originates from.

attributes.name: model_sha1_hash
attributes.documentation: SHA1 key of the original codec model.

attributes.name: codec_id
attributes.documentation: Identifier for the modeling element in the codec dimension.

attributes.name: location
attributes.documentation: Where the element was located in the original source.

elements.name: entities::model_type
elements.documentation: Types of models with regards to the current generation taking place.

attributes.name: target
attributes.documentation: The element is part of the target model.

attributes.name: pdm_reference
attributes.documentation: The element was part of a reference model which is a PDM.

attributes.name: non_pdm_reference
attributes.documentation: The element was part of a reference model which is regular dogen model.

attributes.name: not_yet_determined
attributes.documentation: The origin of the element is not yet known.

elements.name: entities::sha1_hash
elements.documentation: Stores a SHA1 hash.

elements.name: entities::codec_id
elements.documentation: ID of the elment as sourced from the codec model, if any.

elements.name: entities::logical_id
elements.documentation: ID of the elment in the logical dimension.

elements.name: entities::physical_meta_id
elements.documentation: ID of the meta-element in the physical dimension.

elements.name: entities::codec_location
elements.documentation: Location of a modeling element in the codec dimension.

attributes.name: line
attributes.documentation: Line number where the element was defined.

attributes.name: column
attributes.documentation: Column number where the element was defined.

elements.name: entities::logical_provenance
elements.documentation: Source of a model element in the logical dimension.

attributes.name: codec
attributes.documentation: Provenance of the current element in the codec dimension.

attributes.name: logical_name
attributes.documentation: Provenance of the current element in the logical dimension.

attributes.name: logical_meta_name
attributes.documentation: Provenance of the current element in the logical dimension as a meta-element.

elements.name: entities::logical_meta_id
elements.documentation: ID for a logical meta-element.

elements.name: entities::label
elements.documentation: A label is a key-value pair that can be used by the processing engine in a flexible way.

attributes.name: key
attributes.documentation: Key of the label.

attributes.name: value
attributes.documentation: Value associated with this label.

elements.name: entities::tagged_value
elements.documentation: Represents a tagged value in a similar spirit to UMLs.

attributes.name: tag
attributes.documentation: Tag name.

attributes.name: value
attributes.documentation: Value associated with this tag.

elements.name: entities::logical_name
elements.documentation:
Name of an element in logical space.

A name represents a point or a region in logical space, and this point or region can
only be used by one element. Names can be uniquely identified by their qualified ID.

Name has the following properties: a) two different points or regions in logical
space cannot have the same name and b) the same point in logical space can only
have one and only one name.

Names are required in addition to just using the qualfied ID representation
because we use them to infer all sorts of properties for an element (namespaces,
naming files, etc).

attributes.name: id
attributes.documentation: Identifier for this logical element.

attributes.name: location
attributes.documentation: Where the name is located in element space.

attributes.name: is_container
attributes.documentation: If true, the name indicates an element that can contain other elements.

elements.name: entities::logical_location
elements.documentation: Identifies a hierarchy of containment within the logical space.

attributes.name: external_modules
attributes.documentation:
All modules external to the model itself.

It is sometimes useful to create a model within a set of existing
modules. In this case, the model does not own the existing modules and
they are considered "external" to the model. This is useful, for
example, when declaring a model within a larger project such as @e
dogen::logical. In this case, @e dogen is the external module.

attributes.name: model_modules
internal_modules
attributes.documentation: Sub-modules within a model.

attributes.name: element
attributes.documentation:
Name of the owning element, if any.

For coding elements which are located within other logical elements
that are not modules, such as attributes, inner classes, etc.

elements.name: entities::qualified_representations
elements.documentation: All available qualified representations of a name.

attributes.name: dot
attributes.documentation: Qualified identifier using "." as the separator.

attributes.name: colon
attributes.documentation: Qualified identifier using "::" as the separator.

attributes.name: identifiable
attributes.documentation:
Representation of the identifier that can usable as an identifier on all of the
supported technical spaces, using the entire name structure.

elements.name: entities::physical_meta_location
elements.documentation:
Location of an entity or set of entities in the physical meta-model.

These must be populated in order, e.g. in order to have a backend we must have a
meta-model; in order to have a facet we must have a backend and in order to have a
formatter we must have a facet. We may not have any.

attributes.name: meta_model
attributes.documentation:
Top-most container for the physical space.

The meta-model is always expected to be  @e masd.

attributes.name: backend
attributes.documentation: Name of the backend that owns this field, if any.

attributes.name: facet
attributes.documentation: Name of the facet that owns this field, if any.

attributes.name: archetype
attributes.documentation: Name of the archetype that owns this field, if any.

elements.name: entities::physical_meta_name
elements.documentation:
Name of an element in physical space.

A name represents a point or a region in physical space. It can only be used by one
physical element. Names can be uniquely identified by their qualified ID.

Name has the following properties: a) two different points or regionsin physical
space cannot have the same name and b) the same point or region in physical space
can only have one and only one name.

attributes.name: id
attributes.documentation: Identifier for this physical meta-element.

attributes.name: location
attributes.documentation: Location for a meta-name in physical space.

attributes.name: id
attributes.documentation: Identifier for this logical meta-element.

elements.name: entities::technical_space
elements.documentation: Models need to declare upfront the technical space they will target.

attributes.name: agnostic
attributes.documentation: Abstract technical space which is mapped to concrete technical spaces.

attributes.documentation: The C++ programming language.

attributes.name: csharp
attributes.documentation: The C# programming language.

attributes.name: cmake
attributes.documentation: CMake meta build system.

attributes.name: xml
attributes.documentation: Extensible Markup Language.

attributes.name: odb
attributes.documentation: ODB options.

attributes.name: sln
attributes.documentation: Visual studio solution.

elements.name: entities::physical_name
elements.documentation: Name of a physical model element.

attributes.name: simple
attributes.documentation: File or directory simple name.

attributes.name: id
attributes.documentation: ID for a physical element.

elements.name: entities::Nameable
elements.documentation: Ability to have a name.

attributes.name: simple
attributes.documentation: Simple name for a modeling element.

elements.name: entities::logical_meta_physical_id
elements.documentation: ID in the logical-physical space.

attributes.name: logical_id
attributes.documentation: ID of the element in the logical dimension.

attributes.name: physical_meta_id
attributes.documentation: ID of the element in the physical dimension.

elements.name: entities::physical_id
elements.documentation: ID for a physical element.

elements.name: helpers
elements.documentation: Assorted helpers used to construct domain entities.

elements.name: helpers::building_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst building.

elements.name: helpers::flattening_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst flattening a name.

elements.name: helpers::printing_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst pretty printing.

elements.name: helpers::separators
elements.documentation: Available separators to be used by the pretty printer.

attributes.name: angle_brackets
attributes.documentation: Enclose name elements in '<' and '>'.

attributes.name: double_colons
attributes.documentation: Separate name elements with a '::'.

attributes.name: dots
attributes.documentation: Separate name elements with a '.'.

elements.name: entities::model_id
elements.documentation: ID for a model.

elements.name: entities::stereotype
elements.documentation: Stereotype.

elements.name: entities::logical_name_tree
elements.documentation:
Adds support for name composition as a tree-like structure.

A logical name tree has the responsibility of representing an instantiation of a
generic type with all of its type parameters, which themselves can also be generic
types and so on. It may also represent the simpler case of a non-generic type, in
which case only the parent name is populated and there are no children.

attributes.name: current
attributes.documentation: Name for the current level of the tree.

attributes.name: children
attributes.documentation: Names of the child elements.

attributes.name: are_children_opaque
attributes.documentation:
If true, the association with its children can be opaque.

Children are considered opaque when the parent does not require knowledge
about the childs' internal structure. This is the case, for example, with C and
C++ pointers, references and so on.

attributes.name: is_circular_dependency
attributes.documentation: If true, the presence of the current name causes a circular dependency.

attributes.name: is_current_simple_type
attributes.documentation: Returns true if @e current is a simple type such as a built-in or an enumeration.

attributes.name: is_floating_point
attributes.documentation: If true, "current" stores a floating point type.

elements.name: entities::QualifiedRepresentations
elements.documentation: Name with multiple qualified representations.

attributes.name: qualified
attributes.documentation: Contains the name according to different representations.

elements.name: helpers::node
elements.documentation:
Node in a tree of logical names.

Temporary data structure used to build trees of logical names.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.documentation: Parent in a tree.

attributes.name: data
attributes.documentation: Current node.

attributes.name: children
attributes.documentation: Child nodes in a tree.

elements.name: helpers::parsing_error
elements.documentation: A fatal error has occurred while parsing.

elements.name: helpers::validation_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred during validation.

attributes.name: logical_meta_id
attributes.documentation: Identifier of the meta-element in the logical dimension.

attributes.name: meta_names
attributes.documentation: All meta-names that belong to this group.

attributes.name: canonical_locations
attributes.documentation:
Maps a concrete archetype location to its canonical form, if the canonical
form is supported. Otherwise no such mapping will exist.

attributes.name: archetype_for_label
attributes.documentation: Maps a label to archetype ID within the present logical manifold.

elements.name: entities::physical_meta_name_indices
elements.documentation: Containing physical meta-names, indexed as required by use cases.

attributes.name: all
attributes.documentation: All meta-names.

attributes.name: facet_names_by_backend_name
attributes.documentation: Qualified names of facets by qualified names of backends.

attributes.name: archetype_names_by_logical_meta_name
attributes.documentation: Physical meta-names by logical meta-names.

attributes.name: archetype_names_by_backend_by_facet
attributes.documentation: Archetype names by qualified backend and facet names
